page.title: 09THE RIVER LUGG AT AYMESTREY
page.content: The stretch of the Lugg between the bridges at Aymestrey and Lyepole is one of the most beautiful in Britain. The steeply wooded sides with their deciduous and coniferous trees provide a natural habitat for wildlife,many varieties of bird including the occasional{kingfisher}; squirrels, {badgers, otters and wild mink. The river flows over a limestone bed,very clean and ideal for the{trout and{grayling}which dominate the river. The maximum weight for both types seems to be 1lb. but most are above a half lb. The occasional{salmon}has also been reported. The fishing is private and restricted to fly. The{weir}which is about half a mile above the bridge at Aymestrey is a popular picnic spot with a small rocky beach and water deep enough to bathe.
